column4: Hi everyone. One question: I have ubuntu installed on my laptop and I have a problem regarding the SOUND. When I plug the headphones in, still, the sound comes out through the laptop speakers as well. This didn't happen in Windows. Does anyone know how to fix it? Thanks
may you type '      lspci | grep -i "audio"       ' in a terminal and paste the output ?
may you also tell me the exact model of your laptop ?
be as accurate as you can. there are a lot of sony and all of them don't have the same version of the audio chipset you're using ;)
sure, thanks
a last command, sorry  : cat /proc/asound/card0/codec\#* | grep Codec
to type it in terminal?
yes. it's to know the exact version of the audio chipset. all the vaio's don't use the same
here it is Codec: Realtek ALC262
okies
type the command "gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base" in order to edit the alsa config file
at the end of the line, add :       options snd-hda-intel model=sony-assamd
then you can reboot and enjoy :) if it doesn't work (or if the whole sound disappears :P) we'll try another model
done, thanks. rebooting
Wow, thanks. it works
you're welcome :) may you remind me your model so that i add it to the french doc's database, please ?
Sony Vaio: VGN-NR11M/S
nevermind found it back :)
well thanks :D
by the way when you buy a laptop, always try to get one with an HDA intel :) it works just well with the good model
thanks for the tip. I was planning to change this one anyway in the near future
